text.section: A lease contract may be made in any manner sufficient to show agreement, including conduct by both parties which recognizes the existence of a lease contract.
An agreement sufficient to constitute a lease contract may be found although the moment of its making is undetermined.

Although one (1) or more terms are left open, a lease contract does not fail for indefiniteness if the parties have intended to make a lease contract and there is a reasonably certain basis for giving an appropriate remedy.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 363, sec. 13, effective January 1, 1991.
